Far Reach.description: Pieces requiring wide hand spans and stretches, often found in Romantic repertoire.
practice_tips: Practice hand stretches and flexibility exercises daily
Break down wide intervals into smaller, manageable chunks
Use proper hand positioning to maximize reach without tension
Consider using pedal to sustain notes when stretch is too wide
Practice slow scales and arpeggios to build hand flexibility
Far Reach.technical_focus: Hand span development, finger independence, and relaxation techniques

Double Thirds.description: Technical passages featuring parallel thirds, requiring precise finger coordination.
practice_tips: Start with slow, deliberate practice focusing on evenness
Practice each hand separately before combining
Use rhythmic variations to build muscle memory
Focus on maintaining consistent finger pressure
Practice with different articulations (legato, staccato)
Double Thirds.technical_focus: Finger coordination, evenness, and stamina in parallel motion

Multiple Voices.description: Polyphonic textures requiring independent voice leading and clarity.
practice_tips: Practice each voice line separately until fluent
Use different dynamics for each voice to hear independence
Practice two voices at a time before adding the third
Focus on maintaining rhythmic integrity of each line
Analyze the harmonic structure to understand voice relationships
Multiple Voices.technical_focus: Voice independence, contrapuntal clarity, and analytical understanding

Advanced Chords.description: Dense harmonic textures with large, complex chord structures.
practice_tips: Practice chord voicings slowly, ensuring all notes sound clearly
Use arm weight rather than finger strength for dense chords
Practice chord progressions in isolation
Focus on smooth voice leading between chords
Build hand strength through gradual practice
Advanced Chords.technical_focus: Chord voicing, arm weight technique, and harmonic understanding

Advanced Counterpoint.description: Sophisticated contrapuntal writing requiring precision and independence.
practice_tips: Study the score away from the piano to understand structure
Practice with metronome to maintain rhythmic precision
Focus on articulation differences between voices
Practice hands separately with full attention to detail
Record yourself to check for clarity and balance
Advanced Counterpoint.technical_focus: Rhythmic precision, articulation control, and structural understanding
